fullDescription.intro:
Extracts relations triplets contained in sentences of a document by investigating relations of tagged named-entities. The node needs part-of-speech and named-entity tagged documents. Additionally, there has to be a second document column containing lemmatized documents.
However, this node can also be used with plain documents by using the Apply preprocessing option. If this option is selected, part-of-speech tagging, named-entity tagging and lemmatizing will be done by this node. The Stanford CoreNLP default settings are used in this case.
Note: Relation Extraction is a computationally expensive operation. For the usage of this node it is recommended to run KNIME with at least 2GB of heap space. To increase the heap space, change the -Xmx setting in the knime.ini file.
This node is based on Stanford CoreNLP 3.9.1.
For more information about StanfordNLP and Relation Extraction, click here.
fullDescription.option:
The document column to use.
Note: If the Apply preprocessing option is unchecked, the documents have to be tagged by a part-of-speech tagger and a named-entity tagger (optionally).
The document column containing the lemmatized documents.
If checked, part-of-speech tagging, named-entity tagging and lemmatizing will be done by this node.
The number of threads to use.

ports.inPort: The input table which contains the documents and lemmatized documents (if needed).
ports.outPort: The output table which contains data from the input table and extracted relations.
